editorialSummary.text: Old-timey summer venue offering concessions & carnival-style games, plus rides & live entertainment.

originalText.text: Excellent place for the kids. The rides aren't overboard with G-force. Two problems the heat in New York can make the whole experience miserable. Only the frog ride has a fan with mist to help cool down the area. Then there is the topic with the food. Since New York is so diverse they try and make the food to conform with everyone. Which means BLAND. They don't allow you to bring your own food so your at their mercy! Also children under 36 inches enter for FREE NOT RIDE FOR FREE. Cause every ride you must be over 36 inches to ride unless accompanied by an adult which they have to pay.

originalText.text: Ideal location within Central Park, with views to surrounding Manhattan. This amusement park is very compact, so time is not lost walking from one end of the park to the other as in more sprawled out amusement parks. Pricing very fair, especially if one takes the all-day option. Concessions all fast food, but quality is decent, with several options available. Bathrooms spotless, impressive given their volume.

Pricing very fair, especially if one takes the all-day option. Concessions all fast food, but quality is decent, with several options available. Bathrooms spotless, impressive given their volume.

originalText.text: My 4 year old absolutely loved it. Everything was just his size! We went on a weekday and there was very little wait for the rides. There is almost no shade, so on a sunny summer day it can get really hot. The little pavilion is air-conditioned and you can buy very basic food there. I only wish we had time to go back again, as I am concerned that it won't be as much fun for a 5 year old next year. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: Great place for young kids & families to enjoy a nice summer day. My 5 yr old daughter enjoyed our unlimited all day pass. The rides were well suited for her age bracket. There are restrooms there and an indoor area to order food as well as take a break from the summer heat. There's a nice variety of rides for kids even for the kids a little older than 5 yrs old (example: flying swings) but I felt it's mostly suited for younger kids 3-7yrs old. There were a few large fans with water mist to stand in front of when it's too warm. This helped a lot. Great place to visit.

originalText.text: A very fun amusement park that’s impressive for NYC. They of course gouge you with prices for various games, so it’s a racket, but no more than other such parks.
